meanings.sent1: Not sleeping enough can worsen your mood.
meanings.sent2: If you keep scratching the itch, it will worsen.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the leak with tape only seemed to worsen the situation.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs will only worsen the storm ahead.
meanings.sent5: The lack of rain began to worsen the drought-stricken land.

meanings.definition: To deteriorate in quality or condition.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the fruit out in the sun will worsen its freshness.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge started to worsen with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cooking skills would only worsen over time.
meanings.sent4: The relationship began to worsen like a fading photograph.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden continued to worsen without proper care.
